content:
Witten is dropping a bomb today:

DAY: Thursday, 11 February, 16:15-17:15 GMT

SPEAKER: Edward Witten (Institute for Advanced Study)

TITLE: Quantization by Branes and Geometric Langlands

ABSTRACT: In this talk, which is based on work with D. Gaiotto, I will explain a quantum field theory perspective on recent developments in the geometric Langlands program by P. Etinghof, E. Frenkel, and D. Kazhdan (see their paper https://arxiv.org/abs/1908.09677).

More Details: https://researchseminars.org/talk/globalpoisson/34/

Zoom link: https://unige.zoom.us/j/212710401?pwd=cUpFRTNLT0s5Nkg2ZWNsbXhwTGFUQT09
Passcode: 0148962145
Zoom Meeting ID: 212-710-401
YouTube Live: https://youtu.be/uDy_Gpe4ymg
Bit late to be announcing this, isn't it?
It's late, but I bet it'll be on YouTube.
I really can't stand watching talks online myself, or videos, but this subject is all the rage so I thought someone might be interested.
If I watched a talk I didn't absolutely have to, this would be the one.
(I'm helping run the UCR colloquia so I have to watch those talks, and I'm teaching 3 courses at UCR so I have to watch those.)
